name: Black Lentils
properties: Rich in antioxidants - among highest of all legumes
Also known as beluga lentils (resemble caviar)
Stay perfectly intact when cooked, scatter well over salads
Particularly good in Bolognese sauce and dal dishes
benefits: Black lentils are an excellent source of vitamins, minerals, fiber and antioxidants - among the highest antioxidant content of all legumes. Significantly slow stomach-emptying rates of meals eaten hours later, promoting extended satiety. Legumes benefit excess body weight, insulin resistance, high cholesterol, inflammation, and oxidative stress, making them an important part of heart disease prevention. Can be used in various dishes including pasta sauces and Indian dal.
amount: 3/4 cup dried lentils. Part of Daily Dozen - minimum 3 servings of legumes daily

quotes: Legumes – beans, chickpeas, split peas, and lentils – are an excellent source of vitamins, minerals, fibre and antioxidants. In terms of nutrition density, they may give the biggest bang for the buck, benefitting excess body weight, insulin resistance, high cholesterol, inflammation, and oxidative stress, making them an important part of heart disease prevention.
Black lentils, also known as beluga lentils because they resemble caviar, stay perfectly intact when cooked and scatter well over salads.
Lentils and chickpeas have among the highest antioxidant content of legumes. Lentils significantly slow stomach-emptying rates of meals eaten hours later.
